column4: Any idea why I can't add this computer to the Ubuntu One account?
cause u1 is all borked right now :)
create a new user account, log in with it, and connect u1.  Should bring you to ubuntuone SSO to sign in.
I had the same problem with last nights build.
I see, so making a new account should fix it?
I deleted my account only because i couldn't figure out where u1 was storing configs.
i recreated a new account and tried to connect again and it worked.  the first time I tried and it failed, i think it was because SSO failed on the first try, and you don't get another chance.
aha. I had to recover my password, that might've broken its sequence somehow.
yup, its a bug, but i don't think anyone has reported it yet.
seems more like a bug in U1 than a bug in 10.04, though. Hopefully they'll get it hammered out by tonight- might be they're already aware.
I already talked to them about it last night.  They hadn't heard about it.
let me know if recreating your account works.
will do, was waiting to launch firefox until the restricted packages installed
how did you delete the account?
no problem.
lots of ways to do it.
easiest is to just create a new account through system-administration-usersandgroups
Oh, I thought you meant create a new U1 account
actually, try this.
close u1-preferences, then open a terminal and killall -9 ubuntuone-login
then start u1-preferences again andsee if it prompts you to login to SSO again.
massive success
but yes, that worked perfectly. Thanks for your help.
